revised_title: Survey of Lasers for Spectroscopic Use: Optical and Ultraviolet Techniques
tldr: This article discusses the principles and operation of various types of lasers for spectroscopic use, focusing on dye lasers and excimer lasers. It covers topics such as narrow-bandwidth and mode-locked tunable dye lasers, harmonic generation, stimulated Raman scattering, and techniques for generating high-power ultraviolet radiation. The article also explores the advantages and limitations of different laser types and their applications in spectroscopy.
